axes.name: Physicality
axes.description: Degree to which an entity occupies physical space and has material properties.

axes.name: NumericValue
axes.description: Encoded numeric value for computable concepts. Uses log-scale encoding for wide range.

axes.name: NumericScale
axes.description: Order of magnitude (10^n) for numeric values. Enables comparison across scales.

axes.name: UnitDomain
axes.description: Physical dimension category: 0=dimensionless, 1=length, 2=mass, 3=time, 4=temperature, 5=amount, 6=current, 7=luminosity.

axes.name: UnitBase
axes.description: Base SI unit within domain. Combined with UnitDomain to identify exact unit.

axes.name: UnitPrefix
axes.description: SI prefix as power of 10: -12=pico, -9=nano, -6=micro, -3=milli, 0=base, 3=kilo, 6=mega, 9=giga.

axes.name: ComputeDomain
axes.description: Which compute plugin handles this: 0=none, 1=math, 2=physics, 3=chemistry, 4=logic, 5=datetime.

axes.name: ComputeOperationType
axes.description: Type of computation: 0=none, 1=compare, 2=arithmetic, 3=convert, 4=solve, 5=balance.

axes.name: ComputePrecision
axes.description: Required precision level: 0=exact, 1=high, 2=medium, 3=approximate.

axes.name: Mereological
axes.description: Part-whole relationships; encodes mereological structure.

axes.name: MassScale
axes.description: Rough magnitude of mass or weight on a normalized scale.

axes.name: SizeScale
axes.description: Overall spatial extent or size of an entity on a normalized scale.

axes.name: Temperature
axes.description: Abstracted temperature axis used for physical processes and states.

axes.name: Pressure
axes.description: Abstracted pressure axis for fluids, gases, or systems under load.

axes.name: Density
axes.description: Relative density or compactness of an entity or medium.

axes.name: Phase
axes.description: Encodes state such as solid, liquid, gas, or plasma via discrete bands.

axes.name: SpatialExtent
axes.description: Captures whether an entity is point-like, local, or extended over regions.

axes.name: LocationSpecificity
axes.description: Indicates how precisely an entity or event is tied to a concrete location.

axes.name: TemporalPersistence
axes.description: Distinguishes transient events from long-lived or permanent entities.

axes.name: Duration
axes.description: Approximate time span for which an event or state persists.

axes.name: Frequency
axes.description: How often an event or pattern recurs in a given context.

axes.name: CausalityStrength
axes.description: Strength of causal influence associated with an event or relation.

axes.name: DeterminismLevel
axes.description: Indicates whether a process is deterministic or stochastic in character.

axes.name: Reversibility
axes.description: Degree to which a process can be reversed without loss.

axes.name: LivingStatus
axes.description: Whether an entity is biologically living; high values indicate life.

axes.name: SpeciesTaxonomy
axes.description: Encodes high-level biological taxonomy class for living entities.

axes.name: LifeStage
axes.description: Distinguishes juvenile, adult, and senescent stages for organisms.

axes.name: HealthVitality
axes.description: Measures health or vitality of living entities on a coarse scale.

axes.name: CognitionBaseline
axes.description: Represents baseline cognitive capacity, such as non-sapient, animal, or human-level.

axes.name: AgencyBaseline
axes.description: Indicates whether an entity can initiate actions intentionally.

axes.name: ArtifactDevice
axes.description: Marks entities that are artifacts or devices rather than natural objects.

axes.name: ComputationCapability
axes.description: Indicates whether an entity can perform computation and to what degree.

axes.name: LegalEntity
axes.description: Indicates that an entity is recognized as a legal person or organization.

axes.name: JurisdictionAnchor
axes.description: Anchors an entity or rule to a primary legal jurisdiction.

axes.name: KnowledgeClaim
axes.description: Marks vectors that represent propositions or claims rather than concrete objects.

axes.name: MoralValence
axes.description: Represents moral goodness or badness of an act or state.

axes.name: UtilityValue
axes.description: Perceived utility or efficiency value associated with an action or state.

axes.name: SafetyPreference
axes.description: Preference for safety over other objectives; high values indicate strong safety bias.

axes.name: ReliabilityPreference
axes.description: Preference for reliable, robust behaviour over potentially fragile but efficient options.

axes.name: TransparencyPreference
axes.description: Desire for transparent and explainable decisions rather than opaque ones.

axes.name: IncentiveAlignment
axes.description: Measures how well incentives for different actors are aligned.

axes.name: PrestigeValue
axes.description: Captures perceived prestige or status associated with an outcome.

axes.name: EmotionFear
axes.description: Emotional dimension representing fear or anticipated danger.

axes.name: EmotionJoy
axes.description: Emotional dimension representing joy or satisfaction.

axes.name: EmpathyLevel
axes.description: Represents empathy or compassion felt toward affected entities.

axes.name: TrustLevel
axes.description: Stores trust or confidence in an entity, process, or source.

axes.name: EmpiricalLatent0
axes.description: First empirical latent axis reserved for learned features; semantics emerge from data.

computable.description: Reserved dimensions for numeric values, units, and compute plugin metadata
